bug.author: li-zheng-hao
bug.summary: batch process mutilple json files failed
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>Problem</denchmark-h>
i used the code in and the output result is not correct: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22129824/71790497-c56b5100-306b-11ea-9893-5a1ed716d179.png></denchmark-link>
I'm sure there is no problem with my markup,However, the output labeling result is incorrect.
how can i get the file labels_file in labelme2voc.py, i just create the file and input my labels manually,like:
__ignore__ _background_ obj
why the mask and origin image is not match, like the mask rotate 90°?
<denchmark-h:h2>my env:</denchmark-h>
labelme: 3.16.0 system: win10 python: 3.6.0

comments.comment: Which one is rotated in the images you present? The gray background image (the real image) or red annotation?

I update labelme version from 3.16.0 to 3.18.0. And here are my images:
origin image
generate JPEGImages folder image
generate SegmentationClassPNG folder image
generate SegmentationClassVisualization folder image
the code is copy from <denchmark-link:https://github.com/wkentaro/labelme/blob/master/examples/semantic_segmentation/labelme2voc.py>labelme2voc.py</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/wkentaro>@wkentaro</denchmark-link>
and all images' shape is 4000×3000 ( width × height )
Can you possibly upload related files (original image, annotated json file, exported files) as zip? You can upload zip on GitHub comments.
